channel.title: Too many connections from one address
channel.description: I had trouble connecting to localhost so I switched to no-ip. It says Login limit exceeded. Too many connections from your address. Please tell me where I can find X-Logging code fix so I can delete for my server.

item.title: Too many connections from one address
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Damnit. I messed something up and now it says no response from server. Is there any pro coders/server owners that understand everything and haven’t just followed a guide? And own teamviewer. I would accept your help happily. I have vista, and everyone I’ve talked to doesn’t know what to do. Am I just fucked?

Read full topic
item.source: Too many connections from one address

item.title: Too many connections from one address
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

the wanderer:

I had trouble connecting to localhost so I switched to no-ip. It says Login limit exceeded. Too many connections from your address. Please tell me where I can find X-Logging code fix so I can delete for my server.

Sounds like your running 2 of the same ports.
Switch your server port to something like 5555…

  1. Go to your server source directory

  2. Click Server.ini

  3. Remove “43594” and replace with “5555” (Without quotes)

  4. Restart your server, if it still does it, compile and run.

Read full topic
item.source: Too many connections from one address
